sense.name: a definable, or characterized, period of time
sense.examples: We are studying the boreal stage in the class on paleoclimatology. The style of the vase suggests it was made during the later stages of the classical Greek period.

sense.name: a developmental point or event, along a continuum
sense.examples: These insects have a fairly short larval stage. We are only at the beginning stages of gene therapy tailored to the individual. Mary had frequent nausea during the first stage of her pregnancy.

sense.name: large horizontal platform, usually for performances
sense.examples: Each member of the graduating class walked on stage to receive their diploma. The musical was produced on a big sound stage in Hollywood. John will enter stage left, after Mary drinks the potion and begins her soliloquy.

sense.name: the theater, as a profession
sense.examples: He has written several works for stage, television and cinema. She was a big name on the stage during the 1940s. The actor said the stage is his life.

sense.name: a traveled segment of a journey
sense.examples: We completed the first stage of the journey on foot. The second and third stages of our trip will be by motor coach.

sense.name: the context or setting in which something takes place
sense.examples: They are hoping this meeting will set the stage for further negotiations. China is playing an increasing role on the international stage.

sense.name: small platform on a microscope where specimens are placed
sense.examples: The pathologist placed the glass slide on the stage to have a closer look.

sense.name: detachable propelling section of a rocket
sense.examples: Mission control watched as the second stage successfully detached from the rocket. They are testing a new three-stage rocket out in Mojave.

sense.name: amplifying component of an electronic circuit
sense.examples: The text describes a method for creating an integrated circuit stage.
